text: is a former Japanese football player. He played for the Japan national team. ==Biography== Maeda was born in Fukuoka on September 5, 1965. After graduating from Tokai University, he joined Japan Soccer League club All Nippon Airways (later Yokohama Flügels) in 1988. In 1988–89 season, the club got second place and he was selected for the Best Eleven. In 1993, the club won the Emperor's Cup. In Asia, the club won the 1994–95 Asian Cup Winners' Cup and 1995 Asian Super Cup. He retired in 1996. On January 27, 1988, Maeda debuted for the Japan national team against United Arab Emirates. He played as a regular player, and also played at 1990 World Cup qualification.
